title: Verify if the Discount Codes switch is on, then the module box should display in Payment section
Verify user is able to submit a working Discount Code
Verify user is able to submit an invalid Discount Code
Verify Discount Code gives correct discount
Verify the discounted amount is correct in Submissions and Broadleaf
Verify Discount Code is only reflected in Total amount in Payment section
Verify entering a 100% off Discount Code will remove Payment info options
Verify if the Required Login switch is on, then user will have to sign in through OKTA before getting to form
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with the Required Login switch on
And the user is not logged into MLB.com
custom_steps: When the user launches the form
custom_expected: Then the user is required to login

title: OKTA ID captured if Logged In
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with the Required Login switch on
And the user is not logged into MLB.com
And the user fills out the form
custom_steps: When the user submits the form
custom_expected:
Then the user's OKTA ID will be stored in Submission Details next to Okta ID
And the user's OKTA ID will be stored on the submission object in the "userId" field

GET https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/submission/<submissionId>

title: Submission is successful with Kiosk Mode enabled
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with Kiosk mode enabled (ex. https://qa-tools.bam-forms.com/#/forms/0001553714830890-125dc271ffff978e-0001/settings)
And the user fills out the form
custom_steps: When the user submits the form
custom_expected:
Then the submission is successful
And the data of the submission displays properly in Submission Details

title: Submission after refresh is successful
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with Kiosk mode enabled (ex. https://qa-tools.bam-forms.com/#/forms/0001553714830890-125dc271ffff978e-0001/settings)
And the user fills out the form
And the user submits the form
custom_steps:
When the user sits on the submission screen for the time configured in the Form's Settings
And then fills out the form again
And submits the form again
custom_expected: Then the second submission is recorded properly in Submission Details

title: User receives Mobile Alert after opting in
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with the Mobile Opt-In block present
And the user opts into Mobile Alerts
And the user enters their phone number

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user submits the form
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will receive a text message

custom_steps_separated.content: When we check the submission by performing a GET https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/submission/<enterSubmissionId>
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the "mobileAlertStatus" field will have a value of "SUCCESS"

custom_steps_separated.content: When we check the consumer-status of the submission by performing a GET https://qa-submission-consumer-status.bam-forms.com/consumer-status/<enterSubmissionId>
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the "mobileAlertComplete" field will have a value of "true"

title: Submission details show user has opted into channel
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched a form with the Mobile Opt-In block present
And the user has opted into Mobile Alerts
And the user has submitted the form
custom_steps: When the user views their submission in the Form Tool
custom_expected: Then the user will see the channel they opted into in the "Mobile Opt-In" field

title: User does not receive Mobile after not opting in
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with the Mobile Opt-In block present
And the user chooses NOT to opt into Mobile Alerts
And the user enters their phone number

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user submits the form
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will NOT receive a text message

custom_steps_separated.content: When we check the submission by performing a GET https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/submission/<enterSubmissionId>
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the "mobileAlertStatus" field will have a value of "DID_NOT_OPT_IN"

custom_steps_separated.content: When we check the consumer-status of the submission by performing a GET https://qa-submission-consumer-status.bam-forms.com/consumer-status/<enterSubmissionId>
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the "mobileAlertComplete" field will have a value of "true"

title: Verify Document files can be uploaded to a form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input supports all Document file types
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a .pdf, .doc, .docx, .xls, or .xlsx file
custom_expected: THEN The file should upload without any errors

title: Verify Images flies can be uploaded to a form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input supports all Images file types
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a .gif, .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .tif, or .tiff file
custom_expected: THEN The file should upload without any errors

title: Verify Audio files can be uploaded to a form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input supports all Audio file types
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a .mp3, .wav, or .aac file
custom_expected: THEN The file should upload without any errors

title: Verify Video files can be uploaded to a form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input supports all Video file types
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a .mp4, .mov, or .avi file
custom_expected: THEN The file should upload without any errors

title: Verify a progress bar appears while a file is being uploaded
custom_preconds: GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a file to upload
custom_expected: THEN A progress bar should appear while the file is uploading

title: Verify an Upload input without data validation enabled only allows a single file to be uploaded
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input does not have data validation enabled
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a file to upload
AND The fan clicks the Upload button again
AND The fan selects another file to upload
AND The fan clicks the Submit button
custom_expected: THEN The error message "A maximum of 1 files can be uploaded." should display

title: Verify an error message appears if Min Files setting is not met
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input has data validation enabled
AND The Upload input has a Min Files value set
AND The Upload input has a Max Files value set
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan uploads a number of files that is below the set Min Files value
AND The fan clicks the Submit button
custom_expected: THEN An error message should appear

title: Verify an error message appears if Max Files setting is exceeded
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input has data validation enabled
AND The Upload input has a Min Files value set
AND The Upload input has a Max Files value set
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan uploads a number of files that is above the set Max Files value
AND The fan clicks the Submit button
custom_expected: THEN An error message should appear

title: Verify an uploaded file cannot exceed the max file size for that file type
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input supports all file types
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a file that exceeds the max file size for that file type (Note: Max file sizes have been set to: Document 5MB, Image 5MB, Audio 10MB, Video 20MB.)
custom_expected: THEN An error message appears

title: Verify an error message appears if the wrong file type is uploaded
custom_preconds:
GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
AND The Upload input supports some file types (not all file types)
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a file type that is not supported by the Upload input
custom_expected: THEN An error message appears

title: Verify the max length for filename is 100 characters
custom_preconds: GIVEN A fan opens a form that has an Upload input
custom_steps:
WHEN The fan clicks the Upload button
AND The fan selects a file to upload
AND The filename has more than 100 characters (including dots and extensions)
custom_expected: THEN An error message appears

title: File Upload is processed successfully and displays in Submission Details
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with File Upload enabled
And a user uploads a valid file
And successfully submits the form
custom_steps: When the user views the submission details in Form Tool
custom_expected:
Then the file uploaded will be present
And the name of the file will be a unique GUID
And the user can click a link to "Publish File"

title: File Upload object stored within Submission Object
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with File Upload enabled
And a user uploads a valid file
And successfully submits the form
custom_steps:
When the user queries their submission

GET https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/submission/<insertSubmissionID>

(ex. https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/submission/0001618193794383-c6e3b4c6ffffb709-0001)
custom_expected:
Then the fileUploads object will be present in the JSON response
And the systemFileName, originalFileName, reportingLabel, status and isPublished field will be present

"fileUploads": [
        {
            "systemFileName": "72050185-0be1-4ba5-ada6-14785713ec1a.gif",
            "originalFileName": "baseballgif1.gif",
            "reportingLabel": "file-upload-label",
            "status": "PASS",
            "isPublished": false
        }
    ],

title: File Upload is available in the provisioned GCP bucket for that property
custom_preconds:
Given there is a property with a GCP bucket provisioned
And there is a form for that property with File Upload enabled
And a user uploads a valid file
And successfully submits the form
custom_steps: When an administrator views the GCP bucket provisioned for the property
custom_expected:
Then the user will be able to access the file that was uploaded

(Ex. QA uploads go to mlb-bbserv-bff-qa-file-upload-temp)

title: FIle Upload where virus scan fails and displays in Submission details
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with File Upload enabled
And a user uploads a file that will fail virus scan (use attached)
And successfully submits the form
custom_steps: When the user views the submission details in Form Tool
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the file upload present
And the file name will be a unique GUID
And there will be a "FAIL" label on the file
And the user will not be able to publish the file

title: File Upload that fails virus scan is not available in the provisioned GCP bucket for that property
custom_preconds:
Given there is a property with a GCP bucket provisioned
And there is a form for that property with File Upload enabled
And a user uploads a file that will fail the virus scan
And successfully submits the form
custom_steps: When an administrator views the GCP bucket provisioned for the property
custom_expected:
Then the user will NOT see the file that was uploaded

(Ex. QA uploads go to mlb-bbserv-bff-qa-file-upload-temp)

title: Uploading/Creating Promo Codes
custom_preconds:
Given a form has been created with Promo Codes enabled
And the user has uploaded a CSV of promo codes
custom_steps:
When the user performs a GET https://qa-promo-codes.bam-forms.com/promo-code/promo-code::<insertformId>::<insertpromoCode>

(ex. https://qa-promo-codes.bam-forms.com/promo-code/promo-code::0001615821316707-9254ff48ffff94c0-0001::promo32)
custom_expected:
Then a promo code object should be returned
And "status" will be null
And "submissionId" will be null

title: Issuing Promo Code Status
custom_preconds:
Given a form with promo codes enabled and uploaded
And a confirmation email is set up with the promo code variable
And a user submits the form
And is issued a promo code via confirmation email
custom_steps:
When the user checks on the status of the promo code sent to them in the email
And performs a GET https://qa-promo-codes.bam-forms.com/promo-code/promo-code::<insertformId>::<insertpromoCode>

(ex. https://qa-promo-codes.bam-forms.com/promo-code/promo-code::0001615821316707-9254ff48ffff94c0-0001::promo32)
custom_expected:
Then the promo code object is returned
And the "status" is "ISSUED"
And the "submissionId" is the submissionId

title: Promo Code present in Submission Details
custom_preconds:
Given a form with promo codes enabled and uploaded
And a confirmation email is set up with the promo code variable
And a user submits the form
And is issued a promo code via confirmation email
custom_steps: When the user checks the details of their submission in the Form Tool
custom_expected: Then the user will see the issued promo code in the submission details

title: Opt-in reflected in submission details
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with the Newsletter Opt-in block added
And a user fill outs the form
And opts into Newsletters
And submits the form
custom_steps: When they view their submission in the Form Tool
custom_expected:
Then they will see a field for "Email Opt-in"
And the value will be "yes"

title: User who does not Opt-In does not receive Newsletter Email
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with the Newsletter Opt-in block added
And a user fill outs the form
And DOES NOT opt into Newsletters
And submits the form
custom_steps: When the user views the form in Submission Details
custom_expected: Then the "Email Opt-in" field will be blank

title: User who opts into Newsletters receives email
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with the Newsletter Opt-in block added
And a user fill outs the form
And opts into Newsletters
custom_steps: When the user submits the form
custom_expected: Then the user will receive an email welcoming them to the newsletter

title: Order Submission Request - Creation
custom_preconds:
Given a user has launched the transactional form 
And the user has filled out Steps 1 & 2

(ex. https://qa-tools.bam-forms.com/#/forms/0001609942501557-1aa705b16775-0001/settings)
custom_steps:
When the user performs a GET https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/order-submission-request/cart-id/<insertcartID>  

(ex. https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/order-submission-request/cart-id/794227)
custom_expected:
Then an order submission request is returned for that form ID
And the "status" field of the submission request is "PROCESSING"

title: Order Submission Request - Update to Processed
custom_preconds:
Given a user has launched the transactional form
And the user has filled out all details of the form including Payment Details
And the user has submitted the form

(ex. https://qa-tools.bam-forms.com/#/forms/0001609942501557-1aa705b16775-0001/settings)
custom_steps:
When the user performs a GET https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/order-submission-request/cart-id/<insertcartID>

(ex. https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/order-submission-request/cart-id/794227)
custom_expected:
Then an order submission request is returned for that form ID
And the "status" field of the submission request is "PROCESSED"
And the "submissionId" field should be populated with the submissionId

title: Order Submission Request - Already Processed
custom_preconds:
Given a user has launched the transactional form
And the user has filled out all details of the form including Payment Details
And the user has submitted the form

(ex. https://qa-tools.bam-forms.com/#/forms/0001609942501557-1aa705b16775-0001/settings)
custom_steps:
When the When the user performs a PATCH https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/order-submission-request/cart-id/<insertcartId>/submission-id/<insertsubmissionId>

(ex. https://qa-submissions.bam-forms.com/order-submission-request/cart-id/794227/submission-id/0001609945215311-8a50091bffffcaf8-0001)
custom_expected:
Then the user will receive a "409 Conflict" error
and the error message will state that the form is already processed

title: Commerce Details captured in Submission Details
custom_preconds:
Given a user has launched the transactional form
And the user has filled out all details of the form including Payment Details
And the user has submitted the form

(ex. https://qa-tools.bam-forms.com/#/forms/0001609942501557-1aa705b16775-0001/settings)
custom_steps: When the user views the details of their submission in the Form Tool
custom_expected:
Then their is a Commerce Order ID present
And the Commerce Order Total is present and accurate

title: Confirm Purchase details in Broadleaf CSR Admin Tool
custom_preconds:
Given a user has launched the transactional form
And the user has filled out all details of the form including Payment Details
And the user has submitted the form

(ex. https://qa-tools.bam-forms.com/#/forms/0001609942501557-1aa705b16775-0001/settings)
custom_steps:
When the user views the purchase details in the Broadleaf CSR Admin Tool

(https://mlb.commerce-qa.mlbinfra.com/admin/login
Search for email address in Fulfillment Orders section)
custom_expected:
Then the user's purchase is present
And the product and price are accurate

title: Purchase Confirmation Email is Received
custom_preconds:
Given a user has launched the transactional form
And the user has filled out all details of the form including Payment Details

(ex. https://qa-tools.bam-forms.com/#/forms/0001609942501557-1aa705b16775-0001/settings)
custom_steps: When the user submits the form successfully
custom_expected:
Then the user receives a Purchase Confirmation Email
And the email contains the user's Billing Address
And the email contains the correct product purchased
And the email contains the correct price paid for the product

title: Submission Watchers Receive Submission Notifications
custom_preconds: Given a user is a Submission Watcher on a form
custom_steps: When a submission is made to the form
custom_expected:
Then the user will receive an email
And the email will contain the submissionId
And the email will contain a working link to the Submission
And the email content should be responsive
And the email content should look appropriate in light and dark modes

title: Inactive Submission Watchers are not sent Notifications
custom_preconds: Given a user is an inactive Submission Watcher on a form
custom_steps: When the form is submitted
custom_expected: Then a submission alert will not be generated for that user (PubSub needs to be checked)

title: User receives Confirmation Email following submission
Submission Details shows Confirmation Email Sent
Input Variables can be displayed in Confirmation Email
custom_preconds:
Given there is a form with Confirmation Email enabled
And the form has inputs
And the user has added these variables to the subject header and body of the confirmation email
And the user has filled out the form
custom_steps: When the user submits the form
custom_expected:
Then they will receive a confirmation email
And the email will reflect the values they entered into the input fields

title: Confirmation Email Test sends successfully
"Resend Confirmation Email" sends successfully
custom_preconds:
GIVEN The user is logged into BAM Forms Tool
AND The user opened a form with a Confirmation Email setup
AND The form has submissions
custom_steps:
WHEN The user opens the Submissions page for the form
AND The user clicks on a Transaction ID for one of the submissions
AND The user clicks on the Resend Confirmation Email link
custom_expected:
THEN The confirmation email should be re-sent to the email address the fan submitted
AND The confirmation email is received

title: Submission message is available in GCP PubSub for distribution
